definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]

sentences.english: For Darwin, mate choice simply stopped at copulation.
sentences.chinese: 對達爾文來說，擇偶僅僅停留在交尾。

sentences.english: Mating preferences, too, vary with a society’s level of economic development.
sentences.chinese: 擇偶的選擇也隨一個社會的經濟發展水平而變化。

definition: higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
the families are well-matched in terms of social status (idiom)/(of a prospective marriage partner) an appropriate match
"Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to carry on one's ancestral line
the "good-looks club": people who attach great importance to a person's appearance (pun on 外貿協會|外贸协会 foreign trade association)
